summary:
Test Records for Zimbabwe and Williams as Afghanistan Toil

Date: Dec 27, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Zimbabwe achieved significant milestones in their Test match against Afghanistan, with historic performances from Sean Williams and the team overall.

  • Zimbabwe posted their highest Test innings total of 586 runs.
  • Sean Williams scored 154 runs, setting a new personal best against Afghanistan.
  • Craig Ervine contributed with a score of 104 runs.
  • Zimbabwe managed to create records during their ongoing Test match in Bulawayo, while Afghanistan was struggling at 95 for 2.

title: Pakistan lose their way after Bosch bash hands South Africa advantage - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Pakistan Struggles Against South Africa After Corbin Bosch's Stellar Performance

Date: October 2023 | Source: ESPNcricinfo

In a gripping Test match, Pakistan found themselves trailing South Africa by two runs after a challenging performance, largely influenced by Corbin Bosch's outstanding debut half-century.

The match saw South Africa post a total of 301, bolstered by Bosch's 81 runs, while Pakistan responded with 211 in their first innings and struggled in their second. Here are the key points:

  • Corbin Bosch made history with the highest score by a No. 9 batter on debut in Tests.
  • Pakistan lost three quick wickets, trailing by only two runs at 88 for 3 in their second innings.
  • South Africa's middle order faced criticism for poor shot selection.
  • Pakistan has concerns over variable bounce as they look to build a defendable target.
“Bosch's delight as he ended unbeaten on 81 and was given the new ball in the second innings in a match where he has had a Midas touch.”

The match continues to unfold, with both teams looking to capitalize on their respective strengths in the days ahead.
newTitle: Pakistan Struggles Against South Africa After Corbin Bosch's Stellar Performance

summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Analyzes Yashasvi Jaiswal's Run Out with Virat Kohli

Date: Dec 27, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses a mix-up between Virat Kohli and Yashasvi Jaiswal that led to Jaiswal's run out during the Boxing Day Test against Australia. Sunil Gavaskar provides insights into the situation and the implications of their partnership.

  • Jaiswal and Kohli had a 102-run partnership before the run out occurred.
  • Gavaskar remarks that despite the risk, Kohli would have made his ground if he had run on Jaiswal's call.
  • Justin Langer commented on Pat Cummins' athletic ability in preventing the run.
  • At the end of Day 2, India was at 164/5, trailing by 310 runs.
“It would have been a quick run, and somebody like Virat Kohli would definitely have made it. But the thing was, he looked at the fielder...” - Sunil Gavaskar

The mix-up highlights the critical importance of communication and awareness in cricket, especially during high-pressure situations.

title: PV Sindhu And Venkata Datta Sai's Wedding Decor - NDTV
summary:
PV Sindhu's Unique Floral Decorations For Her Wedding To Venkata Datta Sai In Udaipur

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

The wedding celebration of PV Sindhu and Venkata Datta Sai featured exquisite floral decorations set against a royal backdrop, showcasing a blend of North and South Indian cultures.

  • The wedding started with a royal sangeet inspired by the sets of the classic Mughal-E-Azam.
  • The venue was transformed into a historical escape with jaali detailing and brass lamps.
  • For the Haldi ceremony, the couple chose an unconventional color scheme, moving away from typical yellow.
  • Red and terracotta tones were used for the centre stage with traditional Rajasthani motifs.
  • The Pellikuthuru ceremony showcased a classic white and gold decor with light blooms and brass accents.
  • The varmala ceremony featured a unique blend of purple and red floral arrangements.
  • The reception boasted a lush green palette enhanced by glowing candles and a stunning chandelier.
"The wedding was a complete fusion of the couple's North and South Indian heritage, featuring lush floral and ivory-carved pillars."

Overall, the wedding was a beautifully orchestrated fusion of traditional and modern elements, reflecting the couple's unique styles and backgrounds.
newTitle: PV Sindhu's Unique Floral Decorations For Her Wedding To Venkata Datta Sai In Udaipur

title: IND vs AUS 4th Test Match, Melbourne Weather Updates: Will rain impact India vs Australia Boxing Day Test - The Times of India
summary:
IND vs AUS 4th Test Match, Melbourne Weather Updates: Will rain impact India vs Australia Boxing Day Test on Day 3?

Date: December 28, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Day 3 of the 4th Test between India and Australia at the iconic Melbourne Cricket Ground could face disruptions due to rain, impacting the match's outcome.

  • The visitors, India, are trailing by 310 runs, battling to avoid the follow-on.
  • There is a 79% chance of rain during the afternoon on December 28.
  • Showers are expected during the critical middle session; temperatures forecasted at 23°C and wind gusts up to 48 km/h.
  • Humidity at 58% could benefit swing bowlers, complicating batting conditions.
  • Steve Smith scored 140 for Australia, and Jasprit Bumrah took 4 wickets for India.
  • India ended Day 2 at 164/5, with Jaiswal scoring 82.
“The looming possibility of rain could halt their momentum and may even tempt Australia to enforce the follow-on if the situation demands.”

As the match progresses, the unpredictable weather makes it crucial for India to capitalize while minimizing disruptions.
newTitle: Melbourne Weather Updates: Rain Threatens India vs Australia Boxing Day Test

Ruben Amorim, the manager of Manchester United, has stated that his job is in jeopardy amid the team's ongoing poor performance.

  • United recently suffered a 2-0 defeat against Wolverhampton Wanderers, marking their third consecutive loss.
  • Amorim has acknowledged the challenges of implementing his strategies with limited training since taking over from Erik ten Hag.
  • He emphasized that the role of Manchester United manager comes with inherent pressures and unpredictability.
  • Upcoming matches against tough opponents like Newcastle and Liverpool add to the team's challenges.
“The manager of Manchester United can never, no matter what, be comfortable,” said Amorim.

Amorim recognizes the need for improvement and resilience within the team as they face a critical period in the season.

'Happened with Tendulkar...': India urged to end Rohit Sharma's 'VIP' treatment, stop KL Rahul 'sacrifice', by Manjrekar - Hindustan Times
summary:
India Criticized for Rohit Sharma's VIP Treatment in Cricket

Date: Dec 27, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Sanjay Manjrekar has urged the Indian cricket team to reconsider the preferential treatment given to senior player Rohit Sharma, especially after his recent poor performance, and suggested that it is unfair to KL Rahul, who has performed consistently well.

  • Rohit Sharma struggled again, scoring just three runs in the Melbourne Test against Australia.
  • Sanjay Manjrekar criticizes the 'VIP culture' in Indian cricket.
  • KL Rahul, despite his strong performances, is sidelined for Rohit.
  • Manjrekar cites Sachin Tendulkar's past decisions to emphasize the need for meritocracy in team selection.
  • India currently trails in the Melbourne Test match.
“Just because Rohit Sharma is out of form and is a senior player, you can't be making these kinds of changes that reflect poorly on Indian cricket.” – Sanjay Manjrekar

The article highlights a critical view of the prioritization of senior players over consistently performing ones, calling for a more merit-based approach to team selection.
newTitle: India Criticized for Rohit Sharma's VIP Treatment in Cricket

title: Sunil Gavaskar decodes reason behind India skipper Rohit Sharma's poor form - The Times of India
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar decodes reason behind India skipper Rohit Sharma's poor form

Publication Date: New Delhi

Legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has shed light on the reason behind India captain Rohit Sharma's recent struggles with form, particularly noting issues with his declining reflexes and footwork during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Gavaskar highlighted worries about Rohit Sharma's declining reflexes at age 37.
  • Rohit scored only 3 runs off 12 deliveries in a recent Test match against Australia.
  • He was dismissed trying to play a half-pull shot off Pat Cummins, who has a history of dismissing him.
  • Gavaskar emphasized the importance of continuous play for older athletes to maintain sharpness.
“That is the reason why you're seeing that there is probably not the same sort of footwork as you would expect, because your body is such as you get older.” - Sunil Gavaskar

In conclusion, Gavaskar attributed Rohit's challenges to age-related factors and the impact of breaks from continuous play, pointing to the importance of maintaining form as players age.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Analyzes Rohit Sharma's Recent Struggles in Cricket

Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas had a noticeable altercation during the first day of the fourth Test at the MCG, with BCCI's Roger Binny commenting on the incident.

  • Roger Binny addressed the on-field clash between Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas, emphasizing that such incidents are part of cricket.
  • Kohli was fined 20% of his match fee and received a demerit point for the altercation.

title: Barça's Dani Olmo registration rejected in court - ESPN India
summary:
Barcelona's Dani Olmo Registration Rejected by Court

Date: Dec 27, 2024

Source: ESPN

Barcelona risks having Dani Olmo unavailable for the second half of the season after a court rejected the club's lawsuit to extend his registration beyond Dec. 31.

  • Dani Olmo, signed from RB Leipzig for €57 million, was given a temporary registration due to an injury to Andreas Christensen.
  • Barça sought a court order to prolong registrations, citing workers' rights.
  • LaLiga welcomed the court's decision, stating necessary conditions for interim registration were not met.
  • Barcelona's annual spending cap is set at €426 million, and they are currently non-compliant.
  • Options being explored for registration include presales of VIP seats and personal guarantees from board members.
  • Concerns arise that if not processed, Olmo could leave for free, though sources are downplaying this.
"LaLiga has today learned of the ruling... rejecting the request for the provisional registration of Dani Olmo until June 30, 2025, on the grounds that none of the necessary conditions for the adoption of an interim measure have been met."

Barcelona faces a race against time to secure the registrations of Olmo and Pau Víctor beyond the deadline.
newTitle: Barcelona's Dani Olmo Registration Rejected by Court

Source: Times of India

Sunil Gavaskar discussed the unfortunate run-out of Yashasvi Jaiswal during the Boxing Day Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, attributing it to a mix-up with Virat Kohli that could have been avoided.

  • Jaiswal had scored 82 runs off 118 balls before being run out.
  • The run-out occurred due to a moment of hesitation from Kohli, who was watching the fielders.
  • This incident led to a collapse in the Indian batting lineup, with India going from 153/2 to 164/5.
“It would have been a quick run, and somebody like Virat Kohli would definitely have made it. But the thing was, he looked at the fielder.” – Sunil Gavaskar

The run-out was a pivotal moment in the match, impacting India's chance for a strong finish.

summary:

Legendary batter Sunil Gavaskar has shared a candid review of pacer Mohammed Siraj's performance, urging that he be dropped from the Indian team due to his poor form in the ongoing Border Gavaskar Trophy series.

  • Gavaskar highlights Siraj's disappointing performance, having taken only 13 wickets in seven innings.
